question: Why is the temperature/weather not showing?
answer: There are a few things you can try to resolve the problem:
- Make sure your phone has a Internet connection and location data is activated
- The fitbit app needs to have access to your location data
- If you have an iPhone location data for the fitbit app has to be set to “always” instead of “when using the app”
- Your fitbit device needs to be connected to your phone via Bluetooth
- You also have to allow the watch face to use your location data and connect to the Internet (This usually happens when you check the boxes while installing the app)
- Weather is also only shown when the watch detects that it is on your body

question: How do I change the temperature unit to Farenheit/Celsius?
answer: Fitbit currently links your temperature unit setting to your preferred length unit. So when it's set to miles you get Fahrenheit and when it's set to meters you get Celsius.
You can change your preferred length unit in your Fitbit Profile Settings.
After you changed the setting you have to synchronize the watch face with the Fitbit App. (It can take a couple of minutes till it changes)

question: Does the watch face support 12h clock scheme?
answer: Yes, it does the setting can be changed in your fitbit profile settings
